content: Address book from what site or software?
creator: markwarner22

content: Settings > General > Message List > Preferred address display format > Name only
creator: Yu5tiqX9og

content:
chull_56 said
does using a Private Password actually encrypt the account credentials, or does it just block someone when they're using the Thunderbird program? Asked another way, would a bad actor with access to the profile and access to appropriate sleuthing tools be able to recover the credentials--from the files alone--thus bypassing the private password of the Thunderbird program?

Primary password protects only the stored passwords. It does not protect your emails in the case that someone has already breached your computer.
creator: wsmwk

content:
Thanks sfhowes. 

I've un-checked the two "Place copy in" options in TB Account Settings and then sent myself an email.

The new email shows in TB in the "Sent Mail" folder but not in the "Sent' folder - just as I wanted = good.

Checking in browser gmail, that email shows in the gmail plain "Sent " folder - from this I assume Google just call their normal sent folder just that i.e. "Sent" and didn't bother to name it "Sent Mail". (Or is "Sent Mail" a solely TB expression/name?)

So to tidy up the TB "start page", how do I delete the (hopefully no longer used/needed) Folder called just "Sent" from the TB start page ?
creator: mcbunny09

content:
First, select it by clicking it on the Message List Pane.

Then, there are three methods to delete it.

Method 1: Click "delete" key on the keyboard.

Method 2: Right click on the mouse > Click the trash can icon on the first row.

Method 3: On Message Pane, click the trash can icon (or "Delete" button).
creator: Yu5tiqX9og

content:
jacobbarnett said
The 'Sent' file in my 'Mail' folder exceeds 3 GB (3,224,360,399 bytes) and is not being read in the TB Mail window. How can I reduce the size of this file AND save messages??? 'Sent' message folder IS searchable!!!

What makes you think the size is impacting your ability to read this folder? Please post a screen shot?
creator: wsmwk

content:
Your crash is caused by bitdefender.

Does the crashing stop if you download and install 128.6.0 from https://thunderbird.net/download ?
creator: wsmwk

content: "About Thunderbird" says I am running Version 128.6.0esr currently. Should I download it anyway?
creator: richbesq

content:
Informazioni utili da fornire nelle richieste al forum:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
creator: @next

content:
1. There are two methods to sort emails.

Method 1: View > Sort by.

Method 2: Click "Message list display options" > Click "Sort by".

2. To show column headers, you need to use Table View rather than Cards View. Steps: Click "Message list display options" > Check "Table View".

3. "Message list display options" is located on the right side of Message List Header. If you do not see Message List Header, it is hidden. To show it up: View > Layout > Message List Header.
creator: Yu5tiqX9og
